meta.title: From SODA to WATER
meta.author: Mao Reynolds and Sandy Weisz
meta.message: This week, in observation of Independence Day, weâ€™re celebrating inventions from around 250 years ago. Joseph Priestly invented carbonated water in 1767 after collecting gas from a beer vat in Leeds, England. He wrote of its "peculiar satisfaction", and in 1772 he published a paper entitled *Impregnating Water with Fixed Air*.
